Welcome to ContactsAPI’s documentation!¶

ContactsAPI main¶

ContactsAPI repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.birthday_people(limit: int, offset: int, user: User, db: Session)¶

The birthday_people function returns a list of contacts whose birthday is within the next 7 days. The search for contacts will be among the contacts of a specific user

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts that are returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip before starting to return the records

  • user – User: Current user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts whose birthday is within 7 days and who created the current user

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session)¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database for the specific user

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: contact info

  • user – User: Current user

  • db – Session

Returns:

The contact object

async src.repository.contacts.find_contacts_by_name(firstname: str | None, lastname: str | None, user: User, db: Session)¶

The find_contacts_by_name function takes in a firstname or lastname, as well as the user who is making the request and the database session.

Parameters:

  • firstname – str | None: Find the contact by the firstname if you know it

  • lastname – str | None: Find the contact by lastname if you know it

  • user – User: Current user

  • db – Session: Create a connection to the database

Returns:

A list of contacts created by current user, that match the first name or last name.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_email(email: str, user: User, db: Session)¶

The get_contact_by_email function takes in an email and returns the contact with that email. The search for contacts will be among the contacts of a specific user

Parameters:

  • email – str: Filter the contact by email

  • user – User: Get the user id from the database

  • db – Session

Returns:

A contact object created the user and with the email

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session)¶

The get_contact_by_id function takes in a contact_id and user, and returns the contact with that id.

If not contact with such id, return None

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact we want to get

  • user – User: Get the user’s id from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session object to the function

Returns:

The contact with the specified id

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, user: User, db: Session)¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts created current user.

Parameters:

  • limit (int) – Limit the number of contacts returned.

  • offset (int) – Determine how many contacts to skip before returning the results.

  • user (User) – Get the user from the database.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

All contacts for the user.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session)¶
The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be removed. user (User): The user who is removing the contact. Only contacts belonging to this user can be removed. db (Session): A connection to our database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be removed

  • user – User: Get the user’s id

  • db – Session: Pass a database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object or None

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session)¶

The update_contact function updates a contact with the contact_id in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: The updated data for the contact

  • contact_id – int: the contact id

  • user – User: Current user

  • db – Session: Pass a database session to the function

Returns:

The updated contact

ContactsAPI repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email address of the user to be confirmed

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session)¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Specify the type of data that will be passed to the function

  • db – Session: Create a database session

Returns:

The new user object

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session)¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user with that email. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the type of parameter that is expected

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user that matches the email address

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – User email to get user object

  • url – str: url for new avatar

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The updated user object

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, refresh_token, db: Session)¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user in the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user that is being updated

  • refresh_token – Update the user’s refresh token in the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user object after updating the refresh_token

ContactsAPI routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.birthday_people(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = 0, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The birthday_people function returns a list of contacts with birthdays in the next 7 days.

The function takes an optional user parameter, which is used to filter the results by owner. If no user is provided, all contacts are returned.

Parameters:

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A list of contacts that have birthdays in the next 7 days

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactsModel: Get the data from the request body

  • current_user – User: Get the user who is currently authorised

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A ContactModel object, which is the same as the one in models

async src.routes.contacts.find_contacts_by_name(first_name: str | None = Query(None), last_name: str | None = None, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The find_contact_by_name function is used to find contacts in the database.

It can be filtered by firstname or lastname. The current_user parameter is a dependency that will be injected automatically when the function runs.

Parameters:

  • first_name – str | None: Filter contacts by firstname

  • last_name – str | None: Filter contacts by lastname

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

Returns:

A list of contacts

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_contact function is a GET request that returns the contact with the given ID. The function takes in an optional parameter of contact_id, which is an integer greater than or equal to 1. It also takes in two dependencies: current_user and db.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the path parameter for the contact_id

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object, which is a pydantic model

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact_e(contact_email: str = Path(Ellipsis), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_contact_e function returns a contact by email.

The function takes in an email and returns the contact with that email.

Parameters:

  • contact_email – str: Email of the contact

  • current_user – User: Current user

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A contact object

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = 0, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the current user. The limit and offset parameters are used to paginate the results.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the offset of the first contact to return

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts

async src.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be removed. current_user (User): The user who is making this request. db (Session): A session object

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact to be removed

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository

Returns:

A contact object

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
The function takes three arguments:

  • body: A ContactsModel object containing the new data for the contact.

  • contact_id: An integer representing the ID of an existing Contact to be updated.

  • current_user (optional): A User object representing a user who is logged in and making this request. This argument is optional because it depends on auth_service, which may or may not return a value depending on whether authentication succeeds or fails.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactsModel: Pass the contact data to be updated

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact to be deleted

  • current_user – User: Get the user id of the current authorised user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

Returns:

A contact object

ContactsAPI routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_users_me function is a GET endpoint that returns the current user’s information.

Parameters:

current_user – User: Pass the user object to the function

Returns:

The current_user object

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The update_avatar_user function updates the avatar of a user. It takes in an UploadFile object, which contains the file that will be uploaded to Cloudinary. :param file: Get the file from the request. :type file: UploadFile :param current_user: Get the current user from the database. :type current_user: User :param db: The database session. :type db: Session :return: The updated user

ContactsAPI routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address. It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address.

If user with this email doesn’t exist raise 400 error.

IF user is already confirmed, return message ‘Your email has already been confirmed’

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

A message that the email is already confirmed or a message that the email has been confirmed

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function is used to authenticate a user.

It takes the email and password of the user as input, checks if they are valid, and returns an access token.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

Access and refresh tokens

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns a new access_token, refresh_token, and the type of token (bearer).

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the authorization header

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

A dict with the access_token, refresh_token and token type

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The request_email function is used to send a verification email to the user

with a link that will allow them to confirm their account.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Validate the request body and

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the server

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A message that the user can check their email for confirmation

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Create new user. If user with this email exists, raise 409 error

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the data from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the application

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with the user. Response with 201 status code.

ContactsAPI service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the recipient

  • username – str: Pass the username to the template

  • host – str: Pass the host of the application to the email template

Returns:

A coroutine
